item.title: British Hacker Known As 'Spiderman' Sentenced Over Cyberattack
item.description: July 28, 2017 - The 29-year-old man was given a suspended sentence of one year and eight months in an attack that reportedly knocked out Internet for nearly 1 million people in Germany in November.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 28, 2017 - The 29-year-old man was given a suspended sentence of one year and eight months in an attack that reportedly knocked out Internet for nearly 1 million people in Germany in November. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/28/540022288/british-hacker-known-as-spiderman-sentenced-over-cyberattack

item.title: What If You Booked A Ride â€” And There Was A Matchmaker In The Backseat?
item.description:
July 27, 2017 - Pakistan's popular Careem app ran the campaign. The company thought it was funny. But a lot of women hated it.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/07/27/539560271/pakistani-ride-sharing-app-puts-a-matchmaker-in-the-car

item.title: Social Media Lets Anti-Government Bundys Reach Followers
item.description: July 27, 2017 - Groups who monitor far-right extremists warn that anti-government militants are increasingly using social media to promote armed protests and violence.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 27, 2017 - Groups who monitor far-right extremists warn that anti-government militants are increasingly using social media to promote armed protests and violence. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/27/539682677/social-media-lets-anti-government-bundys-reach-followers

item.title: Rep. Keith Ellison On Trump And The Media
item.description: July 27, 2017 - Minnesota Rep. Keith Ellison tells Rachel Martin that he thinks Twitter should ban President Trump after the president tweeted insults to members of the media.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 27, 2017 - Minnesota Rep. Keith Ellison tells Rachel Martin that he thinks Twitter should ban President Trump after the president tweeted insults to members of the media. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/27/539682647/rep-keith-ellison-on-trump-and-the-media

item.title: Morning News Brief: Health Care, Transgender Service Members, Foxconn, Charlie Gard
item.description: July 27, 2017 - Republicans continue debating health care plans while President Trump tweeted about transgender people in the military. Tony Romm of Recode discusses electronics-maker Foxconn's U.S. factory plans.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 27, 2017 - Republicans continue debating health care plans while President Trump tweeted about transgender people in the military. item.title: How New York's Roosevelt Island Sucks Away Summer Trash Stink
item.description: July 26, 2017 - Underneath high-rise apartment buildings along the 2-mile island, an automated trash disposal system whisks away nearly 6 tons of trash per day through pipes and tubes.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 26, 2017 - Underneath high-rise apartment buildings along the 2-mile island, an automated trash disposal system whisks away nearly 6 tons of trash per day through pipes and tubes. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/26/539304811/how-new-york-s-roosevelt-island-sucks-away-summer-trash-stink

item.title: Hospitals Face Growing Cybersecurity Threats
item.description: July 26, 2017 - Cyberattacks and data breaches are common at health care facilities, and they can put patients' health at risk. Hospitals are behind the curve in beefing up defenses, industry analysts say.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 26, 2017 - Cyberattacks and data breaches are common at health care facilities, and they can put patients' health at risk. Hospitals are behind the curve in beefing up defenses, industry analysts say. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/26/539290596/hospitals-face-growing-cybersecurity-threats

item.title: Military Tries To Cut Through The Noise Of War
item.description:
July 26, 2017 - The military wants to reduce the deafening, chaotic roar of firefight noise so that front-line commanders can communicate with their troops.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/07/26/539438864/military-tries-to-cut-through-the-noise-of-war
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: To Keep Drivers From Leaving, Uber Tries To Treat Them Better
item.description: July 25, 2017 - Uber is changing its harsh termination policies and launching a hotline for drivers in distress. Leaders at the tech company are trying to repair the relationship they say is "broken."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 25, 2017 - Uber is changing its harsh termination policies and launching a hotline for drivers in distress. Leaders at the tech company are trying to repair the relationship they say is "broken." http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/07/25/539227139/to-keep-drivers-from-leaving-uber-tries-to-treat-them-better

item.title: Alabama Woman Stuck In NYC Traffic In 1902 Invented The Windshield Wiper
item.description: July 25, 2017 - Entrepreneur Mary Anderson thought it made no sense that New York streetcar drivers had to keep jumping off to clean snow from the windshield. She soon won a patent for her "window cleaning device."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 25, 2017 - Entrepreneur Mary Anderson thought it made no sense that New York streetcar drivers had to keep jumping off to clean snow from the windshield. She soon won a patent for her "window cleaning device." http://www.npr.org/2017/07/25/536835744/alabama-woman-stuck-in-nyc-traffic-in-1902-invented-the-windshield-wiper

item.title: Apple Unveils New Emoji Designs â€” Including T. Rex And A Zombie
item.description: July 24, 2017 - The world is getting new emoji. Emjoi expert Jeremy Burge talks with Robert Siegel about who gets to decide what icons join the emoji lexicon and how the meaning of those icons can change.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 24, 2017 - The world is getting new emoji. Emjoi expert Jeremy Burge talks with Robert Siegel about who gets to decide what icons join the emoji lexicon and how the meaning of those icons can change. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/24/539087926/apple-unveils-56-new-emoji-including-t-rex-and-a-zombie

item.title: Are Helicopter Parents Ruining Summer Camp?
item.description: July 24, 2017 - In a wired world, summer camp is one of the last phone-free zones. But campers, staff and especially parents don't always appreciate the message.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 24, 2017 - In a wired world, summer camp is one of the last phone-free zones. But campers, staff and especially parents don't always appreciate the message. http://www.npr.org/sections/ed/2017/07/24/533059271/are-helicopter-parents-ruining-summer-camp

item.title: Bikes May Have To Talk To Self-Driving Cars For Safety's Sake
item.description: July 24, 2017 - Autonomous vehicles have gotten pretty good at detecting other cars and pedestrians. But "seeing" bikes and predicting what they'll do is still a challenge. The answer may lie in bikes themselves.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 24, 2017 - Autonomous vehicles have gotten pretty good at detecting other cars and pedestrians. But "seeing" bikes and predicting what they'll do is still a challenge. The answer may lie in bikes themselves. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/07/24/537746346/bikes-may-have-to-talk-to-self-driving-cars-for-safetys-sake

item.title: Creating A 'Dadbot' To Talk With A Dead Father
item.description: July 23, 2017 - NPR's Lulu Garcia-Navarro talks with James Vlahos about his article in Wired. He wrote about creating a chatbot that allows him to "communicate" with his father who died of cancer.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 23, 2017 - NPR's Lulu Garcia-Navarro talks with James Vlahos about his article in Wired. He wrote about creating a chatbot that allows him to "communicate" with his father who died of cancer. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/23/538825555/creating-a-dadbot-to-talk-with-a-dead-father

item.title: Screen Saviors: Can Activism-Focused Games Change Our Behavior?
item.description: July 23, 2017 - In recent years, there has been an influx of games centered on social and political issues from sexism to racism to the refugee crisis. In one of the latest, you rescue animals in a slaughterhouse.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 23, 2017 - In recent years, there has been an influx of games centered on social and political issues from sexism to racism to the refugee crisis. In one of the latest, you rescue animals in a slaughterhouse. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/07/23/538617205/screen-saviors-can-activism-focused-games-change-our-behavior
